item.title: Beacon - a new beginning
item.description:
You can find the download for the project in the ‘Projects’ page on this site or by clicking this link, give it a try and let me know what you think!

Beacon started life as a Global Game Jam project that I worked with a group of friends on, you can find that link here.

The beginning

Ever since that project, Beacon became my sort of “Hello World” game when starting to learn a new game engine. The scope itself is simple yet teaches a lot with lighting, controls, collision, and a bunch of other core skills that can be expanded on in any sort of way. For fun I shared a prototype with a friend I threw together one weekend when really trying to learn Godot and the feedback was far more positive than I expected. From there I decided, yeah I will turn this into a full game.

item.title: Development Continues
item.description:
After my last post I became more motivated than ever to continue working on this project. The focus of this “sprint” so to speak is to clean up the UI as well as add some accessibility features in allowing the user to map their own controls.

Why the focus in UI so early in development? Great question dear reader, while yes I did get a basic outline that works I would have a hard time saying that it is scalable in both the developer time to create a new UI and screen resolution.
